name: Beth O'Leary
bio:
Sunday Times bestselling author of The Flatshare and lots more. The Wake-Up Call is out now 🛎️
Rep: @tanera.simons @darleyanderson_agency

social_posts.post_text:
Cancel your plans tonight and do this instead: 

✅ Grab a cup of something warm
✅ Put on your comfiest PJs
✅ Stream The Flatshare 💕

Original drama series #TheFlatshare is streaming now on #ParamountPlusUK 💙

What a totally surreal and incredible day yesterday was. It was all sparkle and post-it notes and joy. Thank you to @sulkydollstyling, @nikkimakeupandhair and Andrea at @duckanddry for making me feel so glamorous for a total once-in-a-lifetime experience, and to @paramountplusuk for throwing the BEST launch party.

So much love went into the making of The Flatshare TV series. I felt it the first moment I stepped on set, and it was just fizzing through the air at the launch last night. I am truly honoured that these lovely talented people all came to Tiffy and Leon's story with such tenderness and love. Check out the behind-the-scenes chats I've shared in my stories and you'll see what I mean.

The last photo is me right now: coming back to reality with joggers, woolly socks and the edits on my next book, The Wake-Up Call. And coffee. Lots of coffee today...

(Opening photo by @davebenett, next two by @tanera.simons, last one by me and my socks)

#TheFlatshare #paramountplusuk #theflatsharetv #jessicabrownfindlay #anthonywelsh #tvshow #launchparty #booksofinstagram #booktoscreen #bookstagram

Some book recommendations, featuring the best present ever: the clapperboard given to me by the production team behind The Flatshare TV series. They used this when filming Post-It note scenes!

Yinka, Where is Your Huzband? by @lizziedamiblackburn
Exes and O's by @amyleabooks
Last Night by @mhairimcf
Get a Life, Chloe Brown by @taliahibbert
In at the Deep End by @katyemdavies

#igbooks #booksofinstagram #bookstagram #theflatshare #theflatsharetv #paramountplusuk #readersofinstagram #bookrecommendations #igwriters #authorsofinstagram

These top-secret festive documents are now in the possession of the @quercusbooks and @berkleypub teams! 

This stage of the publishing process always gives me the jitters. Up until now, only my husband, agent and editors have read the manuscript, and this is the moment when it's passed to the team who bring the book out into the world, so that they can work on how best to publish the story. It is still a super early draft so part of me is going ARGH DON'T READ IT YET but also... part of me is so excited to share it with a few more people after all the months I've spent alone with these characters squabbling away in my brain!

The Wake-Up Call will be publishing next autumn and you can hit the link in my bio to read the blurb 😊

Now I am off for a cosy Christmas in Yorkshire - it will be my little boy's first time opening his stocking from Santa. I can't WAIT. Wishing you all the happiest of holidays! 🎄

#bookstagram #booktok #newbook #booksofinstagram #igbooks #igauthors #theflatshare #writingcommunity #amwriting #writerscommunity #writersofinstagram #igwriters #bookcommunity #authorsofinstagram

Early start, candlelight and a blank page - because I just deleted everything I wrote yesterday. But it's all fine! All good! All part of the process! (She says, trying not to hyperventilate.)

This song is one of my most played while writing this story. I am finding music SO helpful during this period where I am switching between editing The Wake-Up Call and writing my first draft of Book 6 (this tricksy little document). The Wake-Up Call is all upbeat pop, but this story's playlist is dreamy, folksy and full of love songs...

#amwriting #igwriters #igbooks #theflatshare #bookcommunity #writingcommunity #writersofinstagram #bookstagram #booksofinstagram #authorsofinstagram #writersofinstagram #writersofig

Just one month until The No-Show publishes in paperback! We've kept the orange-squash yellow cover from the hardback edition because we loved it so much - it looks just as gorgeous on the paperback, in my extremely biased opinion.

Sorry about the swearword. Hardbacks are hard on the shins.

#thenoshow #theflatshare #bookstagram #booksofinstagram #booktok #igbooks #igwriters #igauthors #authorsofinstagram #writersofinstagram #writingcommunity #amwriting #amreading @quercusbooks

People often ask me if I have any input into my cover designs. I'm very involved in the UK and US editions, but everywhere else in the world is a complete surprise!

Can you guess where each of these editions was published, and which books they are? Which one's your favourite? And, most important question: now that I've made this reel, how am I going to procrastinate next? (Manuscript is going really well, honest...)

#bookstagram #bookreel #booksofig #igbooks #authorsofinstagram #bookcover #writerscommunity #writingcommunity #booktok #theflatshare #theswitch #theroadtrip #thenoshow #booksofinstagram #amreading

You know how a particular sight or smell can just transport you somewhere? Low sun hitting grass always makes me think of a story I started and abandoned, a book that almost came between The Flatshare and The Switch. I thought of the idea on holiday in Lancashire (hence the grassy field association, I think?) and I miss it often enough to make me wonder if there's actually the germ of something good in there.

However, right now I am editing The Wake-Up Call AND writing Book 6 so thoughts of other book ideas are STRICTLY FORBIDDEN.

And every romance reader knows that when something is forbidden it NEVER happens. Right? 😅

#amwriting #booksofig #igwriters #igbooks #theswitch #theflatshare #writingcommunity #writerscommunity #writersofig #bookcommunity #booksofinstagram #bookstagram #sunset #authorsofinstagram

Two incredibly special novels coming soon - Maame by @jessicabgeorge and The Theory of (Not Quite) Everything by @karagnodde_author. They're very different books but they share a common theme, actually - they're both about women who look after others and are searching for their own paths.

Maame is a heartwarming and empowering coming-of-age story about Maddie, a protagonist whose voice I found totally captivating. To her Ghanaian parents, Maddie is Maame: the one who takes care of the family. She's quiet, responsible and contained. But what would life look like if she wasn't? Out February 14th.

The Theory of (Not Quite) Everything is a tender, uplifting novel about Mimi, a woman whose life is bound tightly to her brother's - he's a mathematical genius, the star of the family, and with their parents gone now, Mimi's life is devoted to him. But when she falls in love (and NOT via her brother's carefully created mathematical algorithm) their relationship is put to the test. Out March 16th.

#bookcommunity #amreading #newbook #bookstagram #booksofinstagram #igbooks #authorsofinstagram #writerscommunity #writingcommunity

It is A MERE TWO DAYS until The No-Show publishes in paperback! 💛 And if you sign up to my newsletter before publication day (Thursday Feb 2nd) then you can be in with a chance to win a £150 bookshop.org voucher, so Thursday is just a GREAT DAY all round. 

Link in my bio to sign up! All the details on how to enter will be in Thursday's newsletter, along with some sentimental ramblings about how wonderful my readers are (spoiler: you're really wonderful).

Good luck!

Look who just showed up...

The No-Show is now out in paperback! 🥳

So many people have said that this book is best read without any expectations of what you'll find, so I won't use this caption space to fill you in on any details. I'll just say... this is an unexpected love story.

Oh, and there's a sneak peek at The Wake-Up Call in the back of this one, so if September feels too far away, you know what to do 😉

Happy reading, paperback lovers - I hope Jane, Siobhan and Miranda find their way into your hearts 💛

Here I am looking dorky and over-excited next to my book, which we've just heard is number 8 on the Sunday Times bestseller list after only three days on sale!! Thank you, thank you, thank you! 💛🧡💛

Slowing down after a hectic few days to celebrate The No-Show hitting number 4 in the paperback chart this week! Thank you SO much if you've bought a copy 💛

All I fancy doing right now is curling up with a coffee and my current read, Wild Things by @lauraekay. I am loving this book SO much - I suspect it'll be one of my favourite books due to publish this year. It's so warm and smart and funny, and it perfectly evokes the pleasure/pain of a huge, heartfelt crush. Out in May and I highly recommend pre-ordering!

#booksofinstagram #igbooks #bookstagram #thenoshow #theflatshare #authorsofinstagram #authorlife #writingcommunity #igwriters #igauthors #writersofinstagram

Sometimes my job is writing, and sometimes my job is glamorous authorish eventy things, and sometimes my job is lying on the floor and thinking REALLY REALLY hard.

Book 6: the most challenging book I've written by a mile. But god, I just can't shake it. I ditch ideas all the time, even when I'm tens of thousands of words in and committed, but this one won't let me go. I feel like it is going to be brilliant.

I'm just not sure how. Hence... floor time.

#amwriting #authorsofinstagram #authorlife #theflatshare #writingcommunity #writersofig #igwriters #booksofig #igbooks #bookstagram #booksofinstagram

Can I have your fantasy recommendations, please?

I used to be a huge fantasy reader, but I drifted away from the genre. I've been rediscovering my old love of @therealsjmaas with the @graphicaudio_official version of ACOTAR this weekend, and it's reminding me how much I love books like this one!

What should I read/listen to next? I like some romance in my fantasy, but otherwise I'm open to suggestions...

#audiobook #booksofig #igbooks #amreading #sarahjmaas #acotar #booksofinstagram #bookstagram #bookcommunity #readersofinstagram #igauthors #authorsofinstagram #bookrecommendations

The Wake-Up Call is being typeset as we speak, which means proofs are coming soon... 🛎️❤️

.

#newbook #booksofig #booksofinstagram #igbooks #authorsofinstagram #theflatshare #thenoshow #amreading #writingcommunity #writerscommunity #writersofig #igauthors #bookstagram

I'm doing very few events at the moment - in all honesty, I tend to get super-nervous before them, and it can end up wiping out a whole writing day, so while I've been working on The Wake-Up Call alongside Book 6, I've mostly squirrelled myself away. But last night at @camberley_library reminded me why it is so worth embracing the nerves and emerging from my writing den from time to time!

It was such a warm, buzzy event, and meeting so many readers afterwards in the signing queue was really lovely. That's always my favourite part - getting proper one-to-one chats with readers.

I'm still burrowed away writing for a few more months, but we already have some exciting event plans in the works for September/October time, when The Wake-Up Call comes out. So I wanted to ask you lot - if I could go anywhere, where would you like me to be this autumn? Your local city, your favourite bookshop, the cool cafe in your town that hosts great events... Give me your suggestions please! 😊

#bookstagram #booksofig #igbooks #authorsofinstagram #authorlife #thenoshow #theflatshare #igauthors #writingcommunity #writersofig #booksofinstagram #library #librarylove #newbook @surrey.librariesuk

Proofs of The Wake-Up Call are here, and you can win one! 😍

I will be giving away TWO copies in my newsletter on Wednesday April 5th, so make sure you're signed up before then! Link is in bio 🙂

This is my most unequivocally joyful novel - it's zingy and funny and fun, and I LOVED writing it. It publishes in September, and here's the blurb...

*****

It's the busiest time of the year, and Forest Manor Hotel is quite literally falling apart. So when sworn enemies Izzy and Lucas are given the same shift on the hotel's front desk, they have no choice but to put their differences aside.

The hotel won't stay afloat without some sort of miracle. But when Izzy returns a guest's lost wedding ring, the reward convinces management this might just fix everything. With four rings still sitting in lost property, the race is on for Izzy and Lucas to save their beloved hotel - and their jobs.

As their bitter rivalry turns into something much more complicated, Izzy and Lucas begin to wonder if there's more at stake here than the hotel's future. Can the two of them make it through the season with their hearts intact?

*****

#newbook #bookstagram #booksofinstagram #igbooks #igauthors #writingcommunity #theflatshare #thenoshow #writersofig #bookreels #booksbooksbooks #romancebooks #giveaway #win #bookgiveaway #authorsofinstagram #authorlife @quercusbooks

I listen to music a lot when I'm writing, and I always say that every book feels different, so the songs are totally unique to each story. Except I just noticed this song snuck on to three of my book playlists, so maybe not...?

I think it's because this song actually sounds like what I want ALL my books to be: love stories for people who feel a little splintered and battered, that celebrate joyful moments not to ignore the hard times but to give them depth and meaning. And a bright spot to return to in a scary world - a feeling of home. (I know this is very grandiose, really, but I'm trying to shake off the "oh I just write rom-coms" attitude and take the "just" out of that sentence, because rom-coms deserve better.)

The sun is out today, the words are flying, and I'm dancing to this song as best I can while parked in a chair writing. Hope you're all having gorgeous sunny days too ☀️

(Photo by the super-talented @hollybobbins_photographer, and featured because of a tenuous porch connection, plus the realisation that I did not make enough of these amazing author photos when they were taken, and also, why does my hair never look like this anymore?)

#amwriting #authorsofinstagram #authorlife #writerscommunity #writingcommunity #igwriters #booksofig #bookstagram #igbooks #author #writingtips #booksofinstagram

🛎️ Here they are, in all their gorgeousness: the UK and US covers for The Wake-Up Call, my next novel, publishing September 26th! Pre-order link in bio! ❤️

AND and and... @bustle have an exclusive extract from the novel to share with you! Head to my stories to read! WHAT A DAY - two covers and an extract. I'm feeling a bit giddy. Blurb below!

--

It's the busiest time of the year, and Forest Manor Hotel is quite literally falling apart. So when sworn enemies Izzy and Lucas are given the same shift on the hotel's front desk, they have no choice but to put their differences aside.

The hotel won't stay afloat without some sort of miracle. But when Izzy returns a guest's lost wedding ring, the reward convinces management this might fix everything. With four rings still sitting in lost property, the race is on for Izzy and Lucas to save their beloved hotel - and their jobs.

As their bitter rivalry turns into something much more complicated, Izzy and Lucas begin to wonder if there's more at stake here than the hotel's future. Can the two of them make it through the season with their hearts intact?

One of my top writing tips is to walk away from your desk and go outside when you're stuck, but do I do this? No I do not! I sit and stare at my manuscript and angst about it and drink tea and check my phone until the dog needs a walk and THEN I go outside and figure the book out.

Basically, Molly is the reason any of my books get written. She says you're welcome and she will accept payment in the form of ear scritches, dog treats, and/or a moment of peace and quiet away from the toddler.

#amwriting #writingcommunity #writersofinstagram #authorsofinstagram #bookstagram #igbooks #igwriters #goldenretriever #dogsofinstagram #writersofig #authorlife #igauthors

Self-editing Book 6 (!) at the moment. Asking all the important questions.

Just spent an absolute dream of a day writing* in @lucyclarke_author's beach hut, which I can confirm is even more magical than it looks on her Instagram. Lucy's so brilliant - it was such a treat to talk writing with her. I've come away giddy on sunshine and inspiration... 🌊

*zero writing occurred

Not included in the reel but very much featured in the holiday: many toddler tantrums, several average takeaways, and some serious delayed onset muscle soreness from attempting a run route my husband completed with no trouble at all.

Also: me talking nonstop about my next book... 🥰

Editing editing editing before I head to Madrid this Friday for @litconmadrid, which I am HIGHLY EXCITED about! I really want to get this manuscript (book SIX!) in better shape before I go, so right now I am glued to this desk.

By this point I am just so in the novel - which is great for character (I know these people inside out right now) but bad for almost everything else, e.g. pacing, plot, and the line-by-line stuff. I just can't see the wood for the trees! This is the stage when I send it to my editors, basically: not when I feel it's ready, but when I feel I am officially unable to make it any better on my own. I essentially throw it at them and say HELP.

Right now, there's still a bit more I want to work on by myself. But I am aaaalmost there...

#amwriting #booksofig
#bookstagram #amediting #authorsofinstagram #igbooks #igwriters #writingcommunity #writersofinstagram #booksofinstagram #theflatshare #newbook #igauthors

36 beautiful, whirlwind hours in Madrid. 

Thank you so much to @litconmadrid and @sumadeletrased @penguinlibros for inviting me over, to @saltacuentos for looking after me and feeding me the BEST food, and @hollandandbooks and Claire for the unbelievably skilled translating.

Finally, thank you to every Spanish reader I met this weekend. It was an incredible thing to connect with so many of you, and to see how stories can bring us together even when we speak different languages. 

I was planning to end this with something flippant or self-deprecating to tone down all the earnestness, but I don't want to - this weekend was just an incredibly special thing. Books are amazing. Readers are awesome. I'm very, very lucky to do what I do, and I swear I'll never take it for granted.

Hello! I've sent Book 6 to my editors!! And to celebrate, @goodreads are giving away 10 copies of The Wake-Up Call to US readers! Or maybe that's not exactly why that's happening, I don't know, I'm very tired, anyway link is in bio if you want to enter and I'm now going to lie on the floor like a starfish!

@berkleyromance #bookstagram #amreading #booksofinstagram #igbooks #authorsofinstagram #writingcommunity #writersofig #newbook #giveaway #theflatshare #thenoshow #betholeary #bookgiveaway #arc #bookcommunity

At the moment I am walking, thinking, tracing the edges of a new story. There is no feeling quite like coming up with an idea. It is closest I think to falling in love. For me, a book is never lovelier than in its first precious moments - when I'm writing, I'm always fighting to capture that feeling on the page, and almost always falling short.

This hazy new idea will be book seven one day - I can hardly believe it. Thank you for reading these stories of mine ❤️

I'm on a top-secret trip exploring a place where I hope to set my next novel! The location is a total giveaway about the story, so despite my camera reel being FULL of beautiful things... here is my actual current view instead. Dusty toes in running shoes.

I always think when I'm researching something for a novel that it's Important Facts I'm after - but so often what actually makes its way into my stories are the tiny details rather than the whens and whats. The facts are kind of a comfort thing for me - I know they're there, and that gives me the confidence not to go on about them on the page. Which means more space for the fun stuff, like feelings. And kissing scenes.

Over the last couple of days, I've seen one bare foot dangling over the edge of a treehouse, gold anklet catching red in the sunset; I've heard the blare of a foghorn in the morning mist; I've smelled dusty, rich, heavy-headed roses in the afternoon sun. I've also written lots of important stuff down, but I'll bet it's the anklet and the roses that'll make it on to the final page.

#amwriting #newbook #igbooks #igauthors #writingcommunity #writersofig #booksofinstagram #bookcommunity #writersofinstagram #authorlife #writingtips #writinglife

Eeee look what arrived while I was away! US advance reading copies of The Wake-Up Call! They are GORGEOUS, and just holding this book lifts my spirits.

I wrote The Wake-Up Call when my little boy was starting at nursery and I was feeling so emotional about that next step. I suddenly wanted to write something that was pure escapism - something fun and bright and sparkly. The sort of book I would reach for when I was feeling sad. This is my most unequivocally joyful book, and I hope it'll bring you some of the escapism it brought me to write.

Swipe across for some incredibly kind words from the super-talented @amyleabooks, @carleyfortune and @gillianmauthor ❤️ And if this has piqued your interest, you can read the blurb and even (maybe, if you are feeling very kind) pre-order at the link in my bio! 

PS While writing this post I have noticed that I have half a squished raspberry attached to my arm, thankfully not visible in the photo... Ah, toddler life.

I have a whole afternoon here today - just me, these gorgeous peonies and the beginnings of a new story.

I've blurred the screen because it was spoiler central on there, but you can see that I'm trying something a bit different - I'm using a mind map tool (Simple Mind) to help me dump all my early ideas on a page. I've never quite found a way to do this that works for me before - I don't love working by hand, so I'm endlessly starting different list docs and spreadsheets on my laptop - but I feel like this might be the answer! Just need to resist the temptation to get totally caught up choosing colour schemes that suit the story, and suchlike... (I'm feeling she's rich blues and greens, maybe?)

#amwriting #newbook #theflatshare #booksofinstagram #thenoshow #booksofig #igwriters #igbooks #writingcommunity #writingtips #authorsofinstagram #authorlife #desksetup #bookstagram #writinglife

A few snippets of The Wake-Up Call for you... It's out in just three months!

Also, these little sprigs are from our garden, and the MOST ENORMOUS COCKROACH (type thing - my insect knowledge is poor) suddenly launched itself out of the bunch while I was taking photographs. Sadly I was too surprised/terrified to  get a picture, and it is now roaming freely in my office, which I am trying really hard to be cool about.

Anyway, pre-order link is in bio if you fancy getting your future self a treat, and I promise there will be no cockroaches in your copies!

#thewakeupcall #theflatshare #thenoshow #newbook #quotes #amwriting #writingcommunity #igbooks #igwriters #authorsofinstagram #booksofinstagram #bookcommunity #igauthors #bookstagram #bookquotes

Two books I've loved recently.

Mrs Nash's Ashes by @sarahadlerwrites is a debut that took me by surprise - I hadn't heard of it before picking it up, then had that lovely feeling within a page or two that I had discovered something really special. It's a sparky, bright, hilarious road-trip rom com with a heroine who is 100% pure sunshine, and it has a touch of Emily Henry to it, which is obviously the highest possible compliment. This one is out now.

Evie Dunmore's latest, The Gentleman's Gambit, was no surprise at all - I was totally confident I'd love it, and I did. A League of Extraordinary Women is one of my all-time favourite historical romance series, and this is its beautiful, sexy, clever finale. It's out in December, but you can preorder now I believe! (Hard to photograph this one as the version I read didn't have a title page, so instead you can see a convenient rundown of the other titles in the series on my Kindle screen, in case @evietheauthor is new to you!)

What are you reading at the moment? 😊

#amreading

A different view from usual, because for some reason this story does not want to be written at my desk? I don't know why. I feel a bit shy of my office all of a sudden. This happened a bit when I was writing The Switch - lots of that novel was written on the sofa, the rug, anywhere but the desk.

I think it's maybe because I'm starting something new, and my desk is a bit... official. Like if I'm working there, I need to be Writing A Book, and right now I feel like playing around. When I was writing The Switch, leaving the desk was definitely about taking the pressure off, and it worked back then, so I'm leaning in and declaring it a sofa day ☺️

PS This "stories" folder that you can just about see on my screen contains all sorts of bits and bobs from as far back as 2012 - scribblings, half-novels and full ones that I wrote when getting published was still a dream. Every time I open it and see those neat little folders for each of my published novels, I still feel a bit awed that this is where I am.
.
.
.
#amwriting #newbook #authorlife #igbooks #igauthors #writersofig
#authorsofinstagram
#writingcommunity #author #theflatshare #thenoshow #bookstagram #igwriters #theswitch #theroadtrip #writingtips

First notes on Book 6 are in from my editors! (They liked it OH THANK GOD not that I've been totally stressing or anything.) So I'm diving back into this story, which will be the next one to publish after The Wake-Up Call.

Structural edits are basically chainsaw work. It's BIG stuff, like, should these events occur in a different order? Is this character needed? Could we do with another few chapters between this happening and that happening? And they are MESSY. I always dither between writing lists of what I need to do and just getting in there and doing the stuff, because sometimes you really don't know the consequences until you've started hacking away at things. For weeks, my manuscript will look like a total state.

I love it, though. It's proper roll-your-sleeves-up, get-stuck-in work, and because the changes are big, you can really see the impact - you can feel the story starting to fall into place. Now the book isn't just mine, either: it's shared with my editors, which is such a lovely feeling after so long alone with a story.

This book is, as my toddler would put it, "a biggie". Big concept, epic love, proper pageturny feelings. Or at least, it will be, I hope - right now it's chaos 😂

Hullo, good afternoon, are you signed up to my newsletter? Because we're sending one out very soon with an extract of The Wake-Up Call (!) so if you're excited to meet Izzy and Lucas before the book publishes in September... may I recommend hitting the link in my bio?

Photo by the brilliant @hollybobbins_photographer 💕
.
.
#booksofinstagram #bookstagram #igauthors #igbooks #authorsofinstagram #theflatshare #thenoshow #theswitch #theroadtrip #newbook #writingcommunity #writersofig #authorlife #writersofinstagram

Absolutely thrilled to announce that @waterstones will be offering signed editions of The Wake-Up Call! You can pre-order yours now at the link in my bio if you are feeling very kind ☺️ We will also have some signed editions available from indie bookshops - I'll share the list as soon as I can!

For the first time since The Flatshare, I'll actually be signing these in the warehouse - usually I am sent "tip-in" pages which are then bound into the final book. But this time I get to sit down with the gorgeous finished copies and sign them that way! Somehow it feels a bit more exciting when I'm signing the actual final books that you'll be holding in your hands.

Would you be interested in seeing a bit of behind-the-scenes stuff at the warehouse when I'm there? Or are book warehouses not exciting? I'm a total book nerd so I'm looking forward to poking around, but maybe that's just me...
.
.
#thewakeupcall #theflatshare #thenoshow #amwriting #booksofig #igbooks #signedbooks #author #bookstagram #writingcommunity #publishing #newbook #booksofinstagram #writersofig #igauthors @quercusbooks
I'm trying to work out how to write a seagull's caw phonetically, all suggestions extremely welcome, and yes this is absolutely critical work to be prioritising in the middle of structural edits...

We're moving house!

Oh it's so emotional to be saying goodbye to this place - the house where we spent so many lockdown days, where we celebrated our pandemic wedding, where we brought our little one home for the first time. And this office! It's been home to Addie and Dylan, Jane, Siobhan and Miranda, Izzy and Lucas, and two beautiful strangers you're yet to meet. I will never forget it💚

But I am SO excited about our new home! We fell in love with it the moment we saw it - it's a happy house, do you know what I mean? It just felt joyful and calm and right. And I can't wait to get my new office set up! 

Now... any tips for managing a toddler while an army of removals people pack your whole life into boxes...?
.
.

Thrilled to introduce you to our audiobook narrators for The Wake-Up Call - @jessiecave and @lino.facioli!

I'm a bit fussy about audiobook narrators. They can make or break a book for me. But I knew the moment I heard Jessie and Lino's samples that they would be perfect. I always find it hard to describe voices, but there's a sort of brightness to Jessie's voice that's so perfect for Izzy, and a richness and weight to Lino's voice that is completely Lucas - plus I LOVE hearing those chapters out loud in Lucas's Brazilian accent. If you're excited for this one, you can pre-order the audiobook now at the link in my bio! Less than a month until it's out now 😱😍

New writing spot - the absolute dream 💚

We're still hunting for the perfect desk (I'd love something that ties in to the history of the house), and if you turned 180 degrees right now you would see an absolute chaos of boxes, but LOOK. That window!

I feel unspeakably lucky to get to sit here and write stories for you. My job for today is to explore my newest idea, a book that's barely more than a whisper of a thing, but that already feels full of hope and heart and healing. I want this one to be the sort of story that reminds you, you're okay. You've got this. You're not alone. 

The feel of a story is so important to me - its tone, colour, sound, I don't know what to call it - because it's what guides me through all the decisions I make as I write. From its very first moments, for instance, The Wake-Up Call felt bright and zingy and sparky; The No-Show felt steadfast and brave, like a hand holding yours. When I get lost or stuck with plot or character, it helps me to remember that core somethingness, that feeling, and to come back to it.

So here I go. New writing spot, new feeling, new story 😊
.
.

Publication week photo dump!

1. Some of Team @quercusbooks, the brilliant people who make my books better, get them on bookshelves, and tell you all that they exist! Geniuses, every one.

3. @carolinehulse1 and @lucyvineauthor, who promised to cause an eye-catching diversion if I ballsed up my speech. So grateful for all the beautiful supportive authors, bookstagrammers, booktokkers, journalists and all-round book lovers who came to the launch.

4. Yum.

5. Recovering, snacking, hydrating, before...

6. Signing at @southamptonwaterstones...

7. Then on to @watsalisbury for a chat with the incredible @lauraekay!

8. Oh I've just realised this isn't in chronological order but ONWARDS, here I am eating pie out of a tupperware in the car park because I cannot currently go more than about 45 minutes without a snack and am about to be...

What a week. Thank you so much if you picked up The Wake-Up Call, came along to an event or shared the love on socials/in real life! It's been such a joy seeing readers introduced to Izzy and Lucas. Now on to Henley tomorrow for @henleylitfest! 🥰

The Wake-Up Call is a Sunday Times bestseller! ❤️😭🩷

I am always blown away by hitting the bestseller list, but this time feels extra special.

In the world of publishing, this is one of the most competitive times of year to publish a hardback. Tons of giants of the author world release their new books round about now - we've got Robert Galbraith, Richard Osman and Jeffrey Archer in the top three, for instance! Basically there are LOADS of brilliant blockbuster books for you to choose from on the shelves.

So for The Wake-Up Call to have snuck in to that bestseller list... wow. THANK YOU. I am totally honoured that so many of you chose to pick up a copy as soon as it published, and got Izzy and Lucas to number ten 🥹

Swipe to see the book's dedication, which has never felt more fitting! Thank you for all your support - I will never take it for granted, and I hope this book brings you enough joy to fill every room of Forest Manor Hotel.
.
.

The desk is a nest of wires today - I'm recording lots of interviews with lovely podcasters! In between, I'm clearing the deck and exploring my newest story, which won't even be the next book you read, it'll be the one after THAT.

One of the strangest things about this job is that I am usually juggling at least three stories at once. Right now, I'm promoting The Wake-Up Call, writing the beginnings of a first draft of Book 7, and waiting for editorial notes on Book 6... and trying to make sure I don't talk about the wrong characters 😳

Also, we still can't decide on the perfect desk for this spot - what would you go for?! I've spent a lot of time on Facebook Marketplace waiting for the dream second-hand one, but it's yet to magically appear...

I don't usually write on Mondays - it's my day at home with my little one - but right now I can't let this story go, so I'm spending his naptime ignoring the mess and nesting here with my laptop. I love this feeling, when the words are just below my skin, fizzing in my fingertips.

The only thing likely to distract me from these shiny new characters of mine is the book on the window sill: @paigetoonauthor's upcoming novel, Seven Summers. I had to put it down for a few weeks while reading other things, and coming back to it has felt like a hug with an old friend. I can't wait to pick Paige's brains on how she creates her beautiful, emotional love stories tomorrow at @waterstonesbath - a very small number of tickets left for this one I believe, so do book if you fancy joining us! 🥰
.
.

Autumn, lately 💛

It sometimes feels strange to hold the two halves of my life in my head at once - I'm sure lots of working parents feel this way. One moment I'm playing "run and splat" with my toddler (run very fast, lie down until commanded to run again, continue on repeat forever - terrible, terrible game to play when pregnant) and the next I'm signing books in heels and a dress with (hopefully) zero baked beans on it. I love it though, all of it, and I think my writing self sits somewhere in between these two extremes - when I write, I'm all the versions of me, maybe. 

Anyway, I'm so excited to head up to London soon to see @salmaelwardany, @lucyvineauthor and lots of you at @waterstonestrafsq, and I'll try to remain baked-bean free for the next six hours or so!
.
.
#autumn #bookstagram #author #authorsofinstagram #igbooks #writingcommunity #toddlerlife #writinglife #mumlife #goldenretriever #booksofinstagram

Totally honoured that The No-Show has been selected as one of Waterstones' Best Paperbacks of 2023 - thank you, @waterstones! It's been so lovely hearing from new readers who have come across this one (my most surprising love story...) in paperback. Also, it's 20% off right now at Waterstones, and there are tons of other gorgeous reads in this promo, just in case you need someone to tempt you into buying yet more books...?

Hello from total immersion in Book 6! Oh, this story. Some of you will have heard me give a few little hints about it during book tour - this is the idea I had years ago but was too afraid to tackle, the (hopefully) epic love story that's taken everything I have to write. I started it in a Google doc on my phone in the hazy darkness of those early days with my son, when night bled into day and life felt heightened in every way. Though most of the words written in night feeds got scrapped, in the end, the book still has some of that time's rawness and intensity, I think.

I am editing it right now, and I'd be lying if I said I have overcome all the old fears about whether I can pull it off, but also, just sometimes, I think it might be... *whispers* good. Really good. Maybe?!

It won't be out for a while, so I can't say too much about it yet, but I will tell you that it's about getting lost and found and holding your loved ones tightly. It's about a love that's fierce and brave. And it's about a very, very foolish mistake, with seriously far-reaching consequences...

Walking Molls and thinking about plot, and characterisation, and that bit in Book 6 with the dancing, and how I can tie Book 7 together, and that story idea I'm not meant to be thinking about because gah! I don't have time to write it!

There is so much I want to get done before the baby comes. I'm very lucky to have supportive publishers who will flex my book schedules around my new little one's arrival, but even so, I want to keep the books coming for you all AND still make time to really enjoy the newborn snuggles (and recover, and heal, and adjust to the new chaos... How DO people manage with a baby and a toddler...?). So Book 6 and Book 7 are both spinning around my head right now, and I'm trying to stay super focused on whichever one is currently open at my desk.

But ooh, this little idea I've had. It keeps popping in when I'm walking the dog, like, hellooo, trying to focus, are you? Look at me, I'm so shiny! And out of genre! (😱) Wouldn't I make a fun little side project? And as much as I try to shove it in the cabinet of curiosities labelled One Day I Might Write This, it KEEPS escaping.

So I don't know. Maybe I will jot a few things down at the weekend. Maybe that'll get it out of my system, as Izzy from The Wake-Up Call might say...
Fans of #TheFlatshare, this one’s for you. Emma Appleton, Laurie Davidson, David Jonsson, Isabella Laughland and Angus Imrie are set to star in Beth O’Leary’s The Road Trip 🚗 #TheRoadTrip

I've wanted to tell you about this for SO LONG - I'm so thrilled I can finally share the news! Get ready to squash in with Addie, Dylan, Marcus, Deb and Rodney, played by @emmajappleton, Laurie Davidson, @davidjonsson__, Isabella Laughland and Angus Imrie, for a properly hilarious and heartwarming adventure.

I knew from the moment I read an early draft of the first script that The Road Trip series was going to be something special. The show is filming now, and it's created by 42 and Paramount, who were behind The Flatshare series! So you know we're in safe hands.

Which character from the book are you most excited to see on screen? 😍
.
.

.
#theroadtrip #bookstagram
#amreading #theflatshare #booktok #booktoscreen #booksofinstagram #igbooks #igauthors #writingcommunity #emmaappleton #lauriedavidson #davidjonsson #betholeary @paramountplusuk

Plot-walking is the best tool I have when I get stuck with a story. There is just something about plodding along with the dog that helps untangle my brain, and I'm so grateful to be feeling well enough in this pregnancy to walk Molly again.

Out here yesterday evening, I was thinking about the book after the next one, which will be filled with hope and healing (and begins with a very troublesome mix-up...). I was also thinking back to The Road Trip, my summery second-chance love story, which I am just so excited to see on screen someday soon. One of the weird and lovely things about having my work adapted is that it means re-engaging with my earlier stories. Each novel I've written feels a bit like a place I've lived: I think of them all nostalgically, and fondly, but they're in the past. It's strange and wonderful to revisit them.

Thank you for all the love around the TV announcement - your excitement brings me so much joy! 🧡
.
.
.
#amwriting #theroadtrip #bookstagram #authorsofinstagram #writinglife #igbooks #igauthors #writingtips #writingcommunity #dogsofinstagram #walk #writersofinstagram

I like to think you can read any of my books at any (ALL!) times of year... but if you're a seasonal reader, here is how I'd categorise them.

Some of these were easy: The Wake-Up Call is set in the run-up to Christmas, and the journey in The Road Trip takes place on one of the hottest days of the year. The No-Show and The Flatshare were trickiest, but I put The Flatshare in summer as it has warm, bright vibes for me, and The No-Show is in spring because it starts on Valentine's Day (...or - crap - is that technically in winter?!) 

Do you agree, or would you shift these around? Would you happily read a wintery book in summertime, and vice versa?

I rarely read mysteries or cosy crime, but I cannot resist a book with an absolutely cracking hook, and this one is a stunner. In How To Solve Your Own Murder by @kristenperrinwrites, Frances is told by a fortune-teller that she will one day be murdered, and spends her whole life gathering evidence on her friends, family and neighbours to prevent it. Nobody takes her seriously - until she's dead.

Her great niece arrives at Frances's country estate to discover that she could inherit everything... if she's the first to solve her eccentric great aunt's murder.

Isn't that just brilliant? I'm loving it so far. This one is out in March 2024!
.
.
.

I spent yesterday on set for The Road Trip TV series, which was incredibly, incredibly exciting! But I can't share any pictures of that, so here is a photo of my latest book instead, (which - ahem - would make an excellent Christmas gift if you're still on the hunt for one). 

Coming back to the desk/reality feels strange this morning - yesterday's amazing day out felt like the perfect end-of-term activity, and now I'm slightly confused to find myself with another working week ahead of me. I'm aiming to write at least 5k more of Book 7 before I clock off for the holidays. Any tips on how to keep myself motivated? I think the answer might be regular mince pie breaks?

Hello, January. New start, new notebooks, news to share with you soon...

Winter sun through that floofy tail 🧡

This was a rare moment of stillness today - I'm always grateful for Molly dragging me out of the house no matter how busy I am. Christmastime flew by and I am suddenly feeling like I'm having a baby VERY SOON. I've got about two months to go, and so much I want to do! I long to be one of those incredibly organised instagrammy people who maps everything out on a beautiful colour-coordinated planner, but instead I'm leaving scrappy lists everywhere and sending slightly mad emails to my agent...

How do you declutter your brain when you have 100 tabs open? Does anyone have a magical method I need in my life this January?

Drinking homemade bubble tea and plotting my new book announcement... 

Argh, I'm equal parts excited and terrified to tell you about this one. This story has such an ambitious concept, and a big part of me still can't believe I've tackled it, but by the sixth published novel the imposter syndrome really should be shutting up, shouldn't it? So I'm drowning out the self-doubt and reminding myself that actually, when I'm not second-guessing myself, I think this is maybe my best book yet.

And if you want a little clue ahead of next Wednesday's announcement... I'll just say that it's my great hope this book will sweep you up and carry you away 🤫

(Bubble tea is my pregnancy obsession, now that coffee disgusts me, and this excellent gigantic mug from @two_lit_chicks podcast is perfect for it. Also, a new desk is coming soon! Why has it taken me so long to get one! Why have I still not sorted that bookcase! Why am I slouching on the sofa instead of doing hip circles on that birthing ball! And so on.)
Snowflake swirls, cold fingertips and candlelight. Perfect writing weather.

ANNOUNCEMENT TIME!

Book 6, my hardest book, my bravest book, and the book that the incredible @gillianmauthor has called the best rom-com she has ever read. 

(Yes, seriously. She said that. And yes, I thought I might faint when she did.)

You can read the full blurb at the link in my bio, and I know it's AGES away but you can pre-order now too, either via the link or from your local indie bookseller 💙

I can't wait to share more about this book with you all over the next year. Expect many nautical puns, my friends!

Lost at sea... with your one-night-stand. 🌊

Thank you all so much for your excitement about the announcement yesterday! I am so lucky to have such passionate, supportive readers - honestly, I still have to pinch myself when I see all your lovely comments and DMs. I wish I could forward them all to teenage me, who DREAMED that one day people would want to read the stories I write. 

Anyway, I thought I would pop this square on my grid in its sunshiney glory so that you have aaaall the info in one spot - blurb below, link in bio!

---

Lexi is looking for no-strings-attached fun with a stranger. She deserves one night for herself, doesn't she?

Zeke is looking for love. But for one night with a woman like Lexi, he'll break his rules ...

Sparks fly at the pub - one passionate kiss leads to another, and they soon end up stumbling home to the marina together. But the next morning, they're unable to part ways as planned.

The houseboat they stayed on last night has been swept out to sea.

How long can Zeke and Lexi survive on a drifting houseboat? Will search and rescue find them? And who will they have become if they both make it back to dry land?

Sun setting and daffodils blooming at the desk last night as I sent Swept Away off for copyedits! 

This is far from the end of things - this manuscript will be back with me in a few weeks' time, accompanied by lots of excellent questions about why characters seem to be closing already-closed doors and quoting conversations that never happened. (Reading through a copyedit is very humbling...)

But it still feels like a landmark moment, especially because I know the wider teams at @berkleypub and @quercusbooks will be reading it at this stage - up until now, it's just with my editors. Their opinions mean so much to me, and this book is a particularly scary one to share. I think it's because I gave so much to it, and because I dared to tackle a concept that I had and loved for years, but lacked the confidence to write until now. I'm a long way from sending this story out into the world, but this feels like its first little nudge in that direction. Eep.

Also... find yourself a friend who sends you daffodils simply to say, spring is coming 💚 Thank you, @gillianmauthor

I know we're only 19 days into 2024 but I am already confident that How to End a Love Story by @yulin.kuang will be one of my favourite romance novels of the year. It is THAT GOOD. The concept:

Helen Zhang hasn't seen Grant Shepherd once in the thirteen years since the tragic accident that bound their lives together forever. Now a bestselling author, Helen finds herself face to face with Grant again - in the writers' room of the TV adaptation of her novels.

It's hot and smart and full of real, tender emotion, the sort of book that works its way into a little nook in your heart. And the writing is SO beautiful. Out this April! 

Is this one on your TBR?
.
.
